title: Textile, early 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: 8-harness satin (light blue) patterned by weft floats (yellow and white) bound in plain weave or 1\3 twill by a supplementary warp (light blue). Supplementary warp interlaces with foundation wefts as 2/2 plain weave. Plain weave bi
description: Empire Period lampas in blue and yellow symmetrical design. Large star motif with rosette in center surrounded by a small square frame and scrolls forming a spray in each corner. Below a garland with three roses in center. Scroll forms a triangle above the garland.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, early 19th century.Medium: silk
Technique: 8-harness satin (light blue) patterned by weft floats (yellow and white) bound in plain weave or 1\3 twill by a supplementary warp (light blue). Supplementary warp interlaces with foundation wefts as 2/2 plain weave. Plain weave bi. 1944-72-5.
